data.author: Huileng Tan
data.title: Klarna CEO backs Trump's 10% credit card cap, criticizing rewards as built on poorer borrowers' debt
data.description: Even people who don't use credit cards pay more for everyday goods because merchants raise prices to cover card fees, said Klarna's CEO.
data.content:
Klarna CEO Sebastian Siemiatkowski said President Donald Trump's plan to cap credit card interest rates for a year makes sense.Spencer Platt/Getty Images

data.author: Nicholas Gordon
data.title: Ascend Money wants to finance the 10 million-plus Thais currently being ignored by traditional banks stuck in the past
data.description: Ascend Money’s work providing financing to Thailand’s underbanked populations helped get the fintech company onto Fortune’s 2025 “Change the World” list.

data.author: Bloomberg
data.title: China examines foreign ETF trades after Jane Street India probe
data.description: China is investigating foreign ETF trades by Jane Street following regulatory issues in India, prompting UBS to pause some transactions.
data.content: China is scrutinizing how Jane Street Group and other foreign firms participate in its $859 billion exchange-traded fund market, seeking information on such activities carried out by brokers, accordi… [+4986 chars]
